cyclone.name: HAROLD
cyclone.current_location: about 480 miles ESE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving quickly westward across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the south-Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-Texas coast between Port Mansfield and Corpus Christi (near Baffin Bay)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to Port O'Connor, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Texas coastline (Rio Grande to Matagorda Bay)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty easterly breezes well below tropical-storm force possible Tuesday; otherwise no damaging winds expected.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for southwest Louisiana; any water-level rise should remain below 1 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of intermittent rain bands possible Tuesday–Wednesday, mainly outer-band activity.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip-current risk along Louisiana beaches.
